The Academic Bulletin covers essential topics in guiding SIT learners' academic progression and provides specific references for learners enrolled in our undergraduate programmes, including those leading to a degree jointly conferred by SIT and its Overseas University (OU) partners. Postgraduate learners in both coursework and research programmes, as well as learners enrolled in credit-bearing courses stackable towards a full qualification, will also find the information in this bulletin useful.
Find out about the philosophy underpinning SIT’s unique applied learning pedagogy and how academic governance platforms ensure programme quality.

Find out about the overarching policies that guide the design of our programmes, ensuring high-quality, learner-focused education by fostering an inclusive environment, innovative teaching methods, and authentic assessments.
Find out information relevant to the different programmes offered by SIT.
Find out about the general academic guidelines and procedures for learners across all our degree, graduate diploma and certificate programmes.
Undergraduate Programmes (via Competency-based Stackable Micro-Credential Pathway)

The formal relationship between a learner and SIT is established in the Student Honour Code signed by learners upon enrolment for AY2024/25 and earlier. This code includes a commitment to adhere to SIT’s rules and regulations. These same rules and regulations are also applicable to learners enrolled in credit-bearing courses stackable towards a full qualification.
in Student Intranet (SIT log-in credentials are required).
SIT adopts a student-centric approach in its educational philosophy. It is committed to service excellence and to providing students with an education of the highest quality.
SIT takes a serious view towards students’ complaints and grievances. Any of such complaints and grievances will be dealt with fairly and in accordance with the Student Grievance Resolution Policy.
in Student Intranet (SIT log-in credentials are required).

The Registrar’s Office (RO) is committed to supporting our learners throughout their academic journey at SIT. RO’s primary mission is to manage the matriculation, academic progression and graduation of our learners, maintain learners’ records and oversee the implementation of SIT’s academic and disciplinary policies. Learners who require assistance may contact us via email.
